data.name: Dialogs_P2PBlocked_msg_Blocked
data.value: Your connection has been disabled because you are using a server that does not support peer-to-peer (P2P) traffic. P2P is not supported on free servers or servers that are numbered 100 or greater. Please use a different server for P2P.
data.comment: The warning message displayed when P2P traffic is detected on servers not allowing it. The number is in the server name like "NL#101".

data.name: Settings_Connection_lbl_QuickConnect_Info

data.comment: The description of Quick Connect settings displayed in the tooltip of ( i ) image next to the label for Quick Connect combo box in Connection tab of Settings window

data.name: Settings_Connection_lbl_AutoConnect_Info
data.value: On app start, you are connected to the selected profile.
data.comment: The description of Auto Connect setting displayed in the tooltip of ( i ) image next to the label for Auto Connect combo box in Connection tab of Settings window

data.name: Dialogs_P2PForward_msg_Warning_1
data.value: Your connection has been automatically rerouted through another server because certain servers do not support file sharing (P2P) traffic. This may reduce your connection speed. Please use servers with the P2P icon
data.comment: The left part of the warning message in Forwarded P2P window. It shall be translated in pair with the resource "Dialogs_P2PForward_msg_Warning_2" as if they combine one text string including imaginary placeholder {0} between them. If translated text suppose to not include any text before the imaginary placeholder {0} then please leave it empty. Do not include placeholder {0} into translated text.

data.name: Dialogs_P2PForward_msg_Warning_2
data.comment: The right part of the warning message in Forwarded P2P window. It shall be translated in pair with the resource "Dialogs_P2PForward_msg_Warning_1" as if they combine one text string including imaginary placeholder {0} between them. If translated text suppose to not include any text aftere the imaginary placeholder {0} then please leave it empty. Do not include placeholder {0} into translated text.

data.name: Dialogs_DisconnectError_msg_KillSwitch
data.value: Kill Switch is blocking all connections to avoid leaking your data. To dismiss this window, click CLOSE. If you would like to temporarily disable Kill Switch and reconnect to the Internet WITHOUT VPN protection, click DISABLE. To turn off Kill Switch permanently, go to <Hyperlink Command="{Binding SettingsCommand}">Settings.</Hyperlink>
data.comment: The text displayed in Disconnect modal window ifn disconnect occured with Kill Switch turned on.

data.name: Dialogs_DisconnectError_btn_Disable
data.comment: The text on Disable button in Disconnect modal window

data.name: Dialogs_DisconnectError_msg_AllAdaptersInUse
data.value: All TAP adapters are in use.
data.comment: The error description displayed in Disconnect modal window if all TAP adapters are in use

data.name: Dialogs_DisconnectError_msg_TapErrorHelp
data.value: Please see this support <Hyperlink Command="{Binding OpenHelpArticleCommand}">article</Hyperlink> how to fix it.
data.comment: The text displayed in Disconnect modal window if TAP error is detected

data.name: Dialogs_DisconnectError_msg_NoTap
data.comment: The error description displayed in Disconnect modal window if TAP adapter is not installed

data.name: Dialogs_DisconnectError_msg_OldVersion
data.value: Current TAP adapter version is outdated.
data.comment: The error description displayed in Disconnect modal window if TAP adapter version is too low

data.name: Dialogs_ServiceStart_Info
data.value: The ProtonVPN Service that is responsible for your VPN connection is not running. It will try to complete your task again shortly. If this problem persists, try restarting the ProtonVPN app. If it still persists, try restarting your PC.
data.comment: The text displayed in Service Start window

data.name: Dialogs_DisconnectError_msg_TierTooLow
data.value: You have been disconnected because your plan was downgraded. Please upgrade your plan to access all countries and premium features.
data.comment: The error description displayed in Disconnect modal window when user subscription plan has been downgraded (not necessarily to Free). The trial period might have been ended or the user might have changed his plan.

data.name: Dialogs_DisconnectError_msg_NoServers
data.value: There are no servers available right now for your selection. Please select a different option.
data.comment: The error description displayed in Disconnect modal window if disconnected because there are no servers available to connect to

data.name: Connecting_lbl_FailedConnection_1
data.comment: The beginning of text for VPN server failed to connect to in Connecting overlay of main app window. It shall be tranlsated as a text before imaginary placeholder {0} in the text string "Connection to {0} has failed". If translated text suppose to not include any text before the placeholder {0} then please leave it empty. Do not include placeholder {0} into translated text.

data.name: NetShieldModal_msg
data.value: NetShield compares your DNS requests to lists of known trackers, ads, and malware. It may block or prevent a website from working correctly if it appears on one of these lists. If you feel a website has been incorrectly marked as malware or an ad, please contact our Support team.
data.comment: The text displayed in NetShield modal window when NetShield feature is turned for the first time

data.name: Dialogs_DisconnectError_msg_TlsCertificateError
data.value: There's a problem validating the VPN server certificate, which might indicate that the network connection is being tampered with or the server you are trying to connect to has a configuration problem. Get help from our customer support by sending a <Hyperlink Foreground="White" Command="{Binding ReportBugCommand}"><Run Text="Bug Report"/></Hyperlink>.
data.comment: The error description displayed in Disconnect modal window if VPN server certificate validation error has occurred

data.name: Login_msg_ExitKillSwitchConfirm
data.value: Kill Switch is blocking all connections to avoid leaking your data.<LineBreak/> Exiting the application will disable the Kill Switch. Do you want to continue?
data.comment: The text displayed in the login window modal when user tries to close the app wihile Kill Switch is active

data.name: Login_lbl_KillSwitch
data.comment: The text displayed on the login window when user was force logged out while Kill Switch is active

data.name: Dialogs_Proxy_msg_ProxyDetected

data.comment: The text displayed in modal window when the app detects system proxy is turned on

data.name: Dialogs_Troubleshooting_msg_GovBlock

data.name: Dialogs_Troubleshooting_msg_IspProblem

data.name: Dialogs_Troubleshooting_msg_Unknown
